parameters.name: CAM_CAP_DELAY
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the delay between image integration start and strobe firing

parameters.name: CAM_CAP_FBACK
parameters.longDesc: Enables camera capture feedback

values.description: Get timestamp of mid exposure (active high)
Get timestamp of mid exposure (active low)

parameters.name: CAM_CAP_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Change time measurement

parameters.name: TRIG_ACT_TIME
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the time the trigger needs to pulled high or low.

parameters.name: TRIG_DISTANCE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the distance at which to trigger the camera.

parameters.name: TRIG_INTERFACE
parameters.longDesc: Selects the trigger interface

parameters.name: TRIG_INTERVAL
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the time between two consecutive trigger events

parameters.name: TRIG_MIN_INTERVA
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the minimum time between two consecutive trigger events the specific camera setup is supporting.

parameters.name: TRIG_PINS
parameters.longDesc: Selects which FMU pin is used (range: AUX1-AUX8 on Pixhawk controllers with an I/O board, MAIN1-MAIN8 on controllers without an I/O board. The PWM interface takes two pins per camera, while relay triggers on every pin individually. Example: Value 56 would trigger on pins 5 and 6. For GPIO mode Pin 6 will be triggered followed by 5. With a value of 65 pin 5 will be triggered followed by 6. Pins may be non contiguous. I.E. 16 or 61. In GPIO mode the delay pin to pin is < .2 uS. Note: only with a value of 56 or 78 it is possible to use the lower pins for actuator outputs (e.g. ESC's).

parameters.name: TRIG_POLARITY
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the polarity of the trigger (0 = active low, 1 = active high )

parameters.shortDesc: PWM neutral output on trigger pin
parameters.name: TRIG_PWM_NEUTRAL
CBRK_AIRSPD_CHK
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 162128 will disable the check for an airspeed sensor. The sensor driver will not be started and it cannot be calibrated. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.name: CBRK_BUZZER
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 782097 will disable the buzzer audio notification. Setting this parameter to 782090 will disable the startup tune, while keeping all others enabled.

parameters.shortDesc: Circuit breaker for engine failure detection
parameters.name: CBRK_ENGINEFAIL
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 284953 will disable the engine failure detection. If the aircraft is in engine failure mode the engine failure flag will be set to healthy WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.name: CBRK_FLIGHTTERM
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 121212 will disable the flight termination action if triggered by the FailureDetector logic or if FMU is lost. This circuit breaker does not affect the RC loss, data link loss, geofence, and takeoff failure detection safety logic.

parameters.name: CBRK_IO_SAFETY
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 22027 will disable IO safety. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.shortDesc: Circuit breaker for rate controller output
parameters.name: CBRK_RATE_CTRL
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 140253 will disable the rate controller uORB publication. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.shortDesc: Circuit breaker for power supply check
parameters.name: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable the power valid checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.shortDesc: Circuit breaker for USB link check
parameters.name: CBRK_USB_CHK
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 197848 will disable the USB connected checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.shortDesc: Circuit breaker for position error check
parameters.name: CBRK_VELPOSERR
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 201607 will disable the position and velocity accuracy checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.shortDesc: Circuit breaker for arming in fixed-wing mode check
parameters.name: CBRK_VTOLARMING
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 159753 will enable arming in fixed-wing mode for VTOLs. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.shortDesc:
Arm authorization parameters, this uint32_t will be split between starting from the LSB:
- 8bits to authorizer system id
- 16bits to authentication method parameter, this will be used to store a timeout for the first 2 methods but can be used to another parameter for other new authentication methods.
- 7bits to authentication method
- one arm = 0
- two step arm = 1
* the MSB bit is not used to avoid problems in the conversion between int and uint
parameters.name: COM_ARM_AUTH
parameters.longDesc: Default value: (10 << 0 | 1000 << 8 | 0 << 24) = 256010 - authorizer system id = 10 - authentication method parameter = 10000msec of timeout - authentication method = during arm

parameters.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ
parameters.longDesc: The default allows to arm the vehicle without a arm authorization.

parameters.shortDesc: Require all the ESCs to be detected to arm
parameters.name: COM_ARM_CHK_ESCS
parameters.longDesc: This param is specific for ESCs reporting status. Normal ESCs configurations are not affected by the change of this param.

parameters.shortDesc:
Maximum value of EKF accelerometer delta velocity bias estimate that will allow arming.
Note: ekf2 will limit the delta velocity bias estimate magnitude to be less than EKF2_ABL_LIM * FILTER_UPDATE_PERIOD_MS * 0.001 so this parameter must be less than that to be useful
parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_AB

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum value of EKF gyro delta angle bias estimate that will allow arming
parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_GB

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum EKF height innovation test ratio that will allow arming
parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_HGT

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum EKF position innovation test ratio that will allow arming
parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_POS

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum EKF velocity innovation test ratio that will allow arming
parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_VEL

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum EKF yaw innovation test ratio that will allow arming
parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_YAW

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum accelerometer inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming
parameters.name: COM_ARM_IMU_ACC

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum rate gyro inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming
parameters.name: COM_ARM_IMU_GYR

parameters.shortDesc:
Maximum magnetic field inconsistency between units that will allow arming
Set -1 to disable the check
parameters.name: COM_ARM_MAG_ANG
COM_ARM_MAG_STR
parameters.longDesc: Deny arming if the estimator detects a strong magnetic disturbance (check enabled by EKF2_MAG_CHECK)

parameters.name: COM_ARM_MIS_REQ
parameters.longDesc: The default allows to arm the vehicle without a valid mission.

parameters.shortDesc: Arm switch is only a button
parameters.name: COM_ARM_SWISBTN
parameters.longDesc: The default uses the arm switch as real switch. If parameter set button gets handled like stick arming.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_WO_GPS
parameters.longDesc: The default allows to arm the vehicle without GPS signal.

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum allowed CPU load to still arm
parameters.name: COM_CPU_MAX
parameters.longDesc: A negative value disables the check.

parameters.shortDesc: Time-out for auto disarm after landing
parameters.name: COM_DISARM_LAND
parameters.longDesc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time-out period in seconds after which the vehicle will be automatically disarmed in case a landing situation has been detected during this period. A zero or negative value means that automatic disarming triggered by landing detection is disabled.

parameters.shortDesc: Time-out for auto disarm if too slow to takeoff
parameters.name: COM_DISARM_PRFLT
parameters.longDesc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time after arming, in seconds, within which the vehicle must take off (after which it will automatically disarm). A zero or negative value means that automatic disarming triggered by a pre-takeoff timeout is disabled.

parameters.name: COM_DL_LOSS_T
parameters.longDesc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameters.name: COM_EF_C2T
parameters.longDesc: Engine failure triggers only below this current value

parameters.name: COM_EF_THROT
parameters.longDesc: Engine failure triggers only above this throttle value

parameters.name: COM_EF_TIME
parameters.longDesc: Engine failure triggers only if the throttle threshold and the current to throttle threshold are violated for this time

parameters.name: COM_FLIGHT_UUID
parameters.longDesc: This number is incremented automatically after every flight on disarming in order to remember the next flight UUID. The first flight is 0.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE1
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE2
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE3
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE4
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE5
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE6
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLT_PROFILE
parameters.longDesc: Describes the intended use of the vehicle. Can be used by ground control software or log post processing. This param does not influence the behavior within the firmware. This means for example the control logic is independent of the setting of this param (but depends on other params).

parameters.shortDesc: High Latency Datalink loss time threshold
parameters.name: COM_HLDL_LOSS_T
parameters.longDesc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameters.shortDesc: High Latency Datalink regain time threshold
parameters.name: COM_HLDL_REG_T
parameters.longDesc: After a data link loss: after this this amount of seconds with a healthy datalink the 'datalink loss' flag is set back to false

parameters.name: COM_HOME_H_T
parameters.longDesc: The home position will be set if the estimated positioning accuracy is below the threshold.

parameters.name: COM_HOME_V_T
parameters.longDesc: The home position will be set if the estimated positioning accuracy is below the threshold.

parameters.shortDesc: Timeout value for disarming when kill switch is engaged
parameters.name: COM_KILL_DISARM

parameters.shortDesc: Timeout for detecting a failure after takeoff
parameters.name: COM_LKDOWN_TKO
parameters.longDesc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the timeframe in seconds within failure detector is allowed to put the vehicle into a lockdown state if attitude exceeds the limits defined in FD_FAIL_P and FD_FAIL_R. The check is not executed for flight modes that do support acrobatic maneuvers, e.g: Acro (MC/FW), Rattitude and Manual (FW). A zero or negative value means that the check is disabled.

values.description: Return at critical level, land at emergency level

parameters.name: COM_LOW_BAT_ACT
parameters.longDesc: Action the system takes at critical battery. See also BAT_CRIT_THR and BAT_EMERGEN_THR for definition of battery states.

parameters.name: COM_MOT_TEST_EN
parameters.longDesc: If set, enables the motor test interface via MAVLink (DO_MOTOR_TEST), that allows spinning the motors for testing purposes.

parameters.name: COM_OBL_ACT
parameters.longDesc: The offboard loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_OF_LOSS_T in seconds.

parameters.shortDesc: Set offboard loss failsafe mode when RC is available
parameters.name: COM_OBL_RC_ACT
parameters.longDesc: The offboard loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_OF_LOSS_T in seconds.

parameters.shortDesc:
Time-out to wait when offboard connection is lost before triggering offboard lost action.
See COM_OBL_ACT and COM_OBL_RC_ACT to configure action
parameters.name: COM_OF_LOSS_T

values.description: Altitude/Manual. Assume use of remote control after fallback. Switch to Altitude mode if a height estimate is available, else switch to MANUAL.
Land/Terminate. Assume no use of remote control after fallback. Switch to Land mode if a height estimate is available, else switch to TERMINATION.

parameters.name: COM_POSCTL_NAVL
parameters.longDesc: This sets the flight mode that will be used if navigation accuracy is no longer adequate for position control. Navigation accuracy checks can be disabled using the CBRK_VELPOSERR parameter, but doing so will remove protection for all flight modes.

parameters.shortDesc: Loss of position failsafe activation delay
parameters.name: COM_POS_FS_DELAY
parameters.longDesc: This sets number of seconds that the position checks need to be failed before the failsafe will activate. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications, a larger value between 5 and 10 should be used.

parameters.name: COM_POS_FS_EPH
parameters.longDesc: This is the horizontal position error (EPH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameters.name: COM_POS_FS_EPV
parameters.longDesc: This is the vertical position error (EPV) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameters.shortDesc: Loss of position probation gain factor
parameters.name: COM_POS_FS_GAIN
parameters.longDesc: This sets the rate that the loss of position probation time grows when position checks are failing. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications a value of 0 should be used.

parameters.shortDesc: Loss of position probation delay at takeoff
parameters.name: COM_POS_FS_PROB
parameters.longDesc: The probation delay is the number of seconds that the EKF innovation checks need to pass for the position to be declared good after it has been declared bad. The probation delay will be reset to this parameter value when takeoff is detected. After takeoff, if position checks are passing, the probation delay will reduce by one second for every lapsed second of valid position down to a minimum of 1 second. If position checks are failing, the probation delay will increase by COM_POS_FS_GAIN seconds for every lapsed second up to a maximum of 100 seconds. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications, a value of 1 should be used.

parameters.shortDesc: Required number of redundant power modules
parameters.name: COM_POWER_COUNT
parameters.longDesc: This configures a check to verify the expected number of 5V rail power supplies are present. By default only one is expected. Note: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK disables all power checks including this one.

parameters.name: COM_PREARM_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Condition to enter the prearmed state, an intermediate state between disarmed and armed in which non-throttling actuators are active.

parameters.name: COM_RC_ARM_HYST
parameters.longDesc: The default value of 1000 requires the stick to be held in the arm or disarm position for 1 second.

parameters.name: COM_RC_IN_MODE
parameters.longDesc: The default value of 0 requires a valid RC transmitter setup. Setting this to 1 allows joystick control and disables RC input handling and the associated checks. A value of 2 will generate RC control data from manual input received via MAVLink instead of directly forwarding the manual input data.

parameters.name: COM_RC_LOSS_T
parameters.longDesc: After this amount of seconds without RC connection the rc lost flag is set to true

parameters.shortDesc: Enable RC stick override of auto and/or offboard modes
parameters.name: COM_RC_OVERRIDE
parameters.longDesc: When RC stick override is enabled, moving the RC sticks immediately gives control back to the pilot (switches to manual position mode): bit 0: Enable for auto modes (except for in critical battery reaction), bit 1: Enable for offboard mode. Only has an effect on multicopters, and VTOLS in multicopter mode.

parameters.name: COM_RC_STICK_OV
parameters.longDesc: If an RC stick is moved more than by this amount the system will interpret this as override request by the pilot.

parameters.name: COM_VEL_FS_EVH
parameters.longDesc: This is the horizontal velocity error (EVH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameters.name: DSHOT_CONFIG
parameters.longDesc: This enables/disables DShot. The different modes define different speeds, for example DShot150 = 150kb/s. Not all ESCs support all modes. Note: this enables DShot on the FMU outputs. For boards with an IO it is the AUX outputs.

parameters.name: DSHOT_MIN
parameters.longDesc: Minimum Output Value for DShot in percent. The value depends on the ESC. Make sure to set this high enough so that the motors are always spinning while armed.

parameters.name: DSHOT_TEL_CFG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run DShot Driver.

parameters.shortDesc: Number of magnetic poles of the motors
parameters.name: MOT_POLE_COUNT
parameters.longDesc: Specify the number of magnetic poles of the motors. It is required to compute the RPM value from the eRPM returned with the ESC telemetry. Either get the number from the motor spec sheet or count the magnets on the bell of the motor (not the stator magnets). Typical motors for 5 inch props have 14 poles.

parameters.name: NAV_AH_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Altitude of airfield home waypoint

parameters.name: NAV_AH_LAT
parameters.longDesc: Latitude of airfield home waypoint

parameters.name: NAV_AH_LON
parameters.longDesc: Longitude of airfield home waypoint

parameters.shortDesc:
Maximum IMU accel magnitude that allows IMU bias learning.
If the magnitude of the IMU accelerometer vector exceeds this value, the EKF delta velocity state estimation will be inhibited.
This reduces the adverse effect of high manoeuvre accelerations and IMU nonlinerity and scale factor errors on the delta velocity bias estimates
parameters.name: EKF2_ABL_ACCLIM

parameters.shortDesc:
Maximum IMU gyro angular rate magnitude that allows IMU bias learning.
If the magnitude of the IMU angular rate vector exceeds this value, the EKF delta velocity state estimation will be inhibited.
This reduces the adverse effect of rapid rotation rates and associated errors on the delta velocity bias estimates
parameters.name: EKF2_ABL_GYRLIM

parameters.shortDesc: Accelerometer bias learning limit. The ekf delta velocity bias states will be limited to within a range equivalent to +- of this value
parameters.name: EKF2_ABL_LIM

parameters.shortDesc:
Time constant used by acceleration and angular rate magnitude checks used to inhibit delta velocity bias learning.
The vector magnitude of angular rate and acceleration used to check if learning should be inhibited has a peak hold filter applied to it with an exponential decay.
This parameter controls the time constant of the decay
parameters.name: EKF2_ABL_TAU

parameters.shortDesc: Process noise for IMU accelerometer bias prediction
parameters.name: EKF2_ACC_B_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Integer bitmask controlling data fusion and aiding methods
parameters.name: EKF2_AID_MASK
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to use GPS data if available 1 : Set to true to use optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to inhibit IMU delta velocity bias estimation 3 : Set to true to enable vision position fusion 4 : Set to true to enable vision yaw fusion. Cannot be used if bit position 7 is true. 5 : Set to true to enable multi-rotor drag specific force fusion 6 : set to true if the EV observations are in a non NED reference frame and need to be rotated before being used 7 : Set to true to enable GPS yaw fusion. Cannot be used if bit position 4 is true.

parameters.shortDesc: 1-sigma tilt angle uncertainty after gravity vector alignment
parameters.name: EKF2_ANGERR_INIT

parameters.shortDesc:
Airspeed fusion threshold. A value of zero will deactivate airspeed fusion. Any other positive
value will determine the minimum airspeed which will still be fused. Set to about 90% of the vehicles stall speed.
Both airspeed fusion and sideslip fusion must be active for the EKF to continue navigating after loss of GPS.
Use EKF2_FUSE_BETA to activate sideslip fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_ARSP_THR

parameters.shortDesc: Upper limit on airspeed along individual axes used to correct baro for position error effects
parameters.name: EKF2_ASPD_MAX

parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed measurement delay relative to IMU measurements
parameters.name: EKF2_ASP_DELAY

parameters.shortDesc: Auxillary Velocity Estimate (e.g from a landing target) delay relative to IMU measurements
parameters.name: EKF2_AVEL_DELAY

parameters.shortDesc: Barometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements
parameters.name: EKF2_BARO_DELAY

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for barometric and GPS height fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_BARO_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.shortDesc:
X-axis ballistic coefficient used by the multi-rotor specific drag force model.
This should be adjusted to minimise variance of the X-axis drag specific force innovation sequence
parameters.name: EKF2_BCOEF_X

parameters.shortDesc:
Y-axis ballistic coefficient used by the multi-rotor specific drag force model.
This should be adjusted to minimise variance of the Y-axis drag specific force innovation sequence
parameters.name: EKF2_BCOEF_Y

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for synthetic sideslip fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_BETA_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.shortDesc: Integer bitmask controlling handling of magnetic declination
parameters.name: EKF2_DECL_TYPE
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable functions. 0 : Set to true to use the declination from the geo_lookup library when the GPS position becomes available, set to false to always use the EKF2_MAG_DECL value. 1 : Set to true to save the EKF2_MAG_DECL parameter to the value returned by the EKF when the vehicle disarms. 2 : Set to true to always use the declination as an observation when 3-axis magnetometer fusion is being used.

parameters.shortDesc:
Specific drag force observation noise variance used by the multi-rotor specific drag force model.
Increasing it makes the multi-rotor wind estimates adjust more slowly
parameters.name: EKF2_DRAG_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for vision angle observations used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message
parameters.name: EKF2_EVA_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc:
Gate size for vision position fusion
Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test
parameters.name: EKF2_EVP_GATE

parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for vision position observations used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message
parameters.name: EKF2_EVP_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for vision velocity estimate fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_EVV_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for vision velocity observations used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message
parameters.name: EKF2_EVV_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Vision Position Estimator delay relative to IMU measurements
parameters.name: EKF2_EV_DELAY

parameters.shortDesc: Whether to set the external vision observation noise from the parameter or from vision message
parameters.name: EKF2_EV_NOISE_MD
parameters.longDesc: If set to true the observation noise is set from the parameters directly, if set to false the measurement noise is taken from the vision message and the parameter are used as a lower bound.

parameters.shortDesc: X position of VI sensor focal point in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_EV_POS_X

parameters.shortDesc: Y position of VI sensor focal point in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Y

parameters.shortDesc: Z position of VI sensor focal point in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Z

parameters.shortDesc: Boolean determining if synthetic sideslip measurements should fused
parameters.name: EKF2_FUSE_BETA
parameters.longDesc: A value of 1 indicates that fusion is active Both  sideslip fusion and airspeed fusion must be active for the EKF to continue navigating after loss of GPS. Use EKF2_ARSP_THR to activate airspeed fusion.

parameters.shortDesc: Baro deadzone range for height fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ
parameters.longDesc: Sets the value of deadzone applied to negative baro innovations. Deadzone is enabled when EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ > 0.

parameters.shortDesc: Height above ground level for ground effect zone
parameters.name: EKF2_GND_MAX_HGT
parameters.longDesc: Sets the maximum distance to the ground level where negative baro innovations are expected.

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_CHECK
parameters.longDesc: Set bits to 1 to enable checks. Checks enabled by the following bit positions 0 : Minimum required sat count set by EKF2_REQ_NSATS 1 : Minimum required PDOP set by EKF2_REQ_PDOP 2 : Maximum allowed horizontal position error set by EKF2_REQ_EPH 3 : Maximum allowed vertical position error set by EKF2_REQ_EPV 4 : Maximum allowed speed error set by EKF2_REQ_SACC 5 : Maximum allowed horizontal position rate set by EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. Detecton of the stationary condition is controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter. 6 : Maximum allowed vertical position rate set by EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. Detecton of the stationary condition is controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter. 7 : Maximum allowed horizontal speed set by EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. Detecton of the stationary condition is controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter. 8 : Maximum allowed vertical velocity discrepancy set by EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT

parameters.shortDesc: GPS measurement delay relative to IMU measurements
parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_DELAY
EKF2_GPS_MASK
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to set which GPS accuracy metrics will be used to calculate the blending weight. Set to zero to disable and always used first GPS instance. 0 : Set to true to use speed accuracy 1 : Set to true to use horizontal position accuracy 2 : Set to true to use vertical position accuracy

parameters.shortDesc: X position of GPS antenna in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_X

parameters.shortDesc: Y position of GPS antenna in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Y

parameters.shortDesc: Z position of GPS antenna in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Z

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for GPS horizontal position fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_P_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_TAU
parameters.longDesc: Sets the longest time constant that will be applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to correct data from multiple GPS data for steady state position differences.

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for GPS velocity fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_V_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for gps horizontal velocity
parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_V_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc:
Default value of true airspeed used in EKF-GSF AHRS calculation.
If no airspeed measurements are avalable, the EKF-GSF AHRS calculation will assume this value of true airspeed when compensating for centripetal acceleration during turns. Set to zero to disable centripetal acceleration compensation during fixed wing flight modes
parameters.name: EKF2_GSF_TAS

parameters.shortDesc: Process noise for IMU rate gyro bias prediction
parameters.name: EKF2_GYR_B_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Rate gyro noise for covariance prediction
parameters.name: EKF2_GYR_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for magnetic heading fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_HDG_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for magnetic heading fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_HEAD_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Determines the primary source of height data used by the EKF
parameters.name: EKF2_HGT_MODE
parameters.longDesc: The range sensor option should only be used when for operation over a flat surface as the local NED origin will move up and down with ground level.

parameters.name: EKF2_IMU_ID
parameters.longDesc: Set to 0 to use system selected (sensor_combined) IMU, otherwise set to the device id of the desired IMU (vehicle_imu).

parameters.shortDesc: X position of IMU in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_X

parameters.shortDesc: Y position of IMU in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Y

parameters.shortDesc: Z position of IMU in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Z

parameters.shortDesc: ID of Magnetometer the learned bias is for
parameters.name: EKF2_MAGBIAS_ID

parameters.shortDesc:
Learned value of magnetometer X axis bias.
This is the amount of X-axis magnetometer bias learned by the EKF and saved from the last flight. It must be set to zero if the ground based magnetometer calibration is repeated
parameters.name: EKF2_MAGBIAS_X

parameters.shortDesc:
Learned value of magnetometer Y axis bias.
This is the amount of Y-axis magnetometer bias learned by the EKF and saved from the last flight. It must be set to zero if the ground based magnetometer calibration is repeated
parameters.name: EKF2_MAGBIAS_Y

parameters.shortDesc:
Learned value of magnetometer Z axis bias.
This is the amount of Z-axis magnetometer bias learned by the EKF and saved from the last flight. It must be set to zero if the ground based magnetometer calibration is repeated
parameters.name: EKF2_MAGBIAS_Z

parameters.shortDesc:
Maximum fraction of learned mag bias saved at each disarm.
Smaller values make the saved mag bias learn slower from flight to flight. Larger values make it learn faster. Must be > 0.0 and <= 1.0
parameters.name: EKF2_MAGB_K

parameters.shortDesc:
State variance assumed for magnetometer bias storage.
This is a reference variance used to calculate the fraction of learned magnetometer bias that will be used to update the stored value. Smaller values will make the stored bias data adjust more slowly from flight to flight. Larger values will make it adjust faster
parameters.name: EKF2_MAGB_VREF

parameters.shortDesc:
Horizontal acceleration threshold used by automatic selection of magnetometer fusion method.
This parameter is used when the magnetometer fusion method is set automatically (EKF2_MAG_TYPE = 0). If the filtered horizontal acceleration is greater than this parameter value, then the EKF will use 3-axis magnetomer fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_ACCLIM

parameters.shortDesc: Process noise for body magnetic field prediction
parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_B_NOISE
EKF2_MAG_CHECK
parameters.longDesc: When set, the EKF checks the strength of the magnetic field to decide whether the magnetometer data is valid. If GPS data is received, the magnetic field is compared to a World Magnetic Model (WMM), otherwise an average value is used. This check is useful to reject occasional hard iron disturbance.

parameters.shortDesc: Magnetometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements
parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_DELAY

parameters.shortDesc: Process noise for earth magnetic field prediction
parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_E_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for magnetometer XYZ component fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_TYPE
parameters.longDesc: Integer controlling the type of magnetometer fusion used - magnetic heading or 3-component vector. The fuson of magnetomer data as a three component vector enables vehicle body fixed hard iron errors to be learned, but requires a stable earth field. If set to 'Automatic' magnetic heading fusion is used when on-ground and 3-axis magnetic field fusion in-flight with fallback to magnetic heading fusion if there is insufficient motion to make yaw or magnetic field states observable. If set to 'Magnetic heading' magnetic heading fusion is used at all times If set to '3-axis' 3-axis field fusion is used at all times. If set to 'VTOL custom' the behaviour is the same as 'Automatic', but if fusing airspeed, magnetometer fusion is only allowed to modify the magnetic field states. This can be used by VTOL platforms with large magnetic field disturbances to prevent incorrect bias states being learned during forward flight operation which can adversely affect estimation accuracy after transition to hovering flight. If set to 'MC custom' the behaviour is the same as 'Automatic, but if there are no earth frame position or velocity observations being used, the magnetometer will not be used. This enables vehicles to operate with no GPS in environments where the magnetic field cannot be used to provide a heading reference. Prior to flight, the yaw angle is assumed to be constant if movement tests controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter indicate that the vehicle is static. This allows the vehicle to be placed on the ground to learn the yaw gyro bias prior to flight. If set to 'None' the magnetometer will not be used under any circumstance. If no external source of yaw is available, it is possible to use post-takeoff horizontal movement combined with GPS velocity measurements to align the yaw angle with the timer required (depending on the amount of movement and GPS data quality). Other external sources of yaw may be used if selected via the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter.

parameters.shortDesc:
Yaw rate threshold used by automatic selection of magnetometer fusion method.
This parameter is used when the magnetometer fusion method is set automatically (EKF2_MAG_TYPE = 0). If the filtered yaw rate is greater than this parameter value, then the EKF will use 3-axis magnetomer fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_YAWLIM

parameters.shortDesc:
Minimum time of arrival delta between non-IMU observations before data is downsampled.
Baro and Magnetometer data will be averaged before downsampling, other data will be point sampled resulting in loss of information
parameters.name: EKF2_MIN_OBS_DT

parameters.shortDesc: Expected range finder reading when on ground
parameters.name: EKF2_MIN_RNG
parameters.longDesc: If the vehicle is on ground, is not moving as determined by the motion test controlled by EKF2_MOVE_TEST and the range finder is returning invalid or no data, then an assumed range value of EKF2_MIN_RNG will be used by the terrain estimator so that a terrain height estimate is avilable at the start of flight in situations where the range finder may be inside its minimum measurements distance when on ground.

parameters.name: EKF2_MOVE_TEST
parameters.longDesc: Scales the threshold tests applied to IMU data used to determine if the vehicle is static or moving. See parameter descriptions for EKF2_GPS_CHECK and EKF2_MAG_TYPE for further information on the functionality affected by this parameter.

parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for non-aiding position hold
parameters.name: EKF2_NOAID_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum lapsed time from last fusion of measurements that constrain velocity drift before the EKF will report the horizontal nav solution as invalid
parameters.name: EKF2_NOAID_TOUT

parameters.shortDesc:
Optical flow measurement delay relative to IMU measurements
Assumes measurement is timestamped at trailing edge of integration period
parameters.name: EKF2_OF_DELAY

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for optical flow fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_OF_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor
parameters.name: EKF2_OF_N_MAX
parameters.longDesc: (when it's reported quality metric is at the minimum set by EKF2_OF_QMIN). The following condition must be met: EKF2_OF_N_MAXN >= EKF2_OF_N_MIN

parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor when it's reported quality metric is at the maximum
parameters.name: EKF2_OF_N_MIN

parameters.shortDesc: X position of optical flow focal point in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_OF_POS_X

parameters.shortDesc: Y position of optical flow focal point in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Y

parameters.shortDesc: Z position of optical flow focal point in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Z

parameters.shortDesc: Optical Flow data will only be used if the sensor reports a quality metric >= EKF2_OF_QMIN
parameters.name: EKF2_OF_QMIN

parameters.shortDesc:
Static pressure position error coefficient for the negative X axis.
This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis.
If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number
parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XN

parameters.shortDesc:
Static pressure position error coefficient for the positive X axis
This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis.
If the baro height estimate rises during forward flight, then this will be a negative number
parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XP

parameters.shortDesc:
Pressure position error coefficient for the negative Y axis.
This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the negative Y (LH) body axis.
If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this will be a negative number
parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YN

parameters.shortDesc:
Pressure position error coefficient for the positive Y axis.
This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the positive Y (RH) body axis.
If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this will be a negative number
parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YP

parameters.shortDesc:
Static pressure position error coefficient for the Z axis.
This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the Z body axis
parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_Z

parameters.shortDesc: Required GPS health time on startup
parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_GPS_H
parameters.longDesc: Minimum continuous period without GPS failure required to mark a healthy GPS status. It can be reduced to speed up initialization, but it's recommended to keep this unchanged for a vehicle.

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal drift speed to use GPS
parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT

parameters.shortDesc: Required satellite count to use GPS
parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_NSATS

parameters.shortDesc: Required speed accuracy to use GPS
parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_SACC

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum vertical drift speed to use GPS
parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT
EKF2_RNG_AID
parameters.longDesc: If this parameter is enabled then the estimator will make use of the range finder measurements to estimate it's height even if range sensor is not the primary height source. It will only do so if conditions for range measurement fusion are met. This enables the range finder to be used during low speed and low altitude operation, eg takeoff and landing, where baro interference from rotor wash is excessive and can corrupt EKF state estimates. It is intended to be used where a vertical takeoff and landing is performed, and horizontal flight does not occur until above EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX. If vehicle motion causes repeated switching between the primary height sensor and range finder, an offset in the local position origin can accumulate. Also range finder measurements are less reliable and can experience unexpected errors. For these reasons, if accurate control of height relative to ground is required, it is recommended to use the MPC_ALT_MODE parameter instead, unless baro errors are severe enough to cause problems with landing and takeoff.

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum absolute altitude (height above ground level) allowed for range aid mode
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX
parameters.longDesc: If the vehicle absolute altitude exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate it's height. This only applies when range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_AID = enabled).

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size used for innovation consistency checks for range aid fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_A_IGATE
parameters.longDesc: A lower value means HAGL needs to be more stable in order to use range finder for height estimation in range aid mode

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed for range aid mode
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_A_VMAX
parameters.longDesc: If the vehicle horizontal speed exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate it's height. This only applies when range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_AID = enabled).

parameters.shortDesc: Range finder measurement delay relative to IMU measurements
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_DELAY

parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for range finder fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for range finder fusion
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: X position of range finder origin in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_X

parameters.shortDesc: Y position of range finder origin in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Y

parameters.shortDesc: Z position of range finder origin in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Z

parameters.shortDesc: Range finder range dependant noise scaler
parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_SFE
parameters.longDesc: Specifies the increase in range finder noise with range.

parameters.name: EKF2_TAS_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.shortDesc: Time constant of the position output prediction and smoothing filter. Controls how tightly the output track the EKF states
parameters.name: EKF2_TAU_POS

parameters.shortDesc: Time constant of the velocity output prediction and smoothing filter
parameters.name: EKF2_TAU_VEL

parameters.shortDesc: Integer bitmask controlling fusion sources of the terrain estimator
parameters.name: EKF2_TERR_MASK
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to use range finder data if available 1 : Set to true to use optical flow data if available

parameters.shortDesc: Terrain altitude process noise - accounts for instability in vehicle height estimate
parameters.name: EKF2_TERR_NOISE

parameters.shortDesc: Process noise for wind velocity prediction
parameters.name: EKF2_WIND_NOISE
EV_TSK_RC_LOSS
parameters.longDesc: Enable/disable event task for RC Loss. When enabled, an alarm tune will be played via buzzer or ESCs, if supported. The alarm will sound after a disarm, if the vehicle was previously armed and only if the vehicle had RC signal at some point. Particularly useful for locating crashed drones without a GPS sensor.

parameters.name: EV_TSK_STAT_DIS
parameters.longDesc: Enable/disable event task for displaying the vehicle status using arm-mounted LEDs. When enabled and if the vehicle supports it, LEDs will flash indicating various vehicle status changes. Currently PX4 has not implemented any specific status events. -

parameters.name: FW_ACRO_X_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full roll stick input in acro mode.

parameters.name: FW_ACRO_Y_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the body y rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full pitch stick input in acro mode.

parameters.name: FW_ACRO_Z_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the body z rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full yaw stick input in acro mode.

parameters.name: FW_ARSP_MODE
parameters.longDesc: For small wings or VTOL without airspeed sensor this parameter can be used to enable flying without an airspeed reading

parameters.name: FW_ARSP_SCALE_EN
parameters.longDesc: This enables a logic that automatically adjusts the output of the rate controller to take into account the real torque produced by an aerodynamic control surface given the current deviation from the trim airspeed (FW_AIRSPD_TRIM). Enable when using aerodynamic control surfaces (e.g.: plane) Disable when using rotor wings (e.g.: autogyro)

parameters.shortDesc: Whether to scale throttle by battery power level
parameters.name: FW_BAT_SCALE_EN
parameters.longDesc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery. The fixed wing should constantly behave as if it was fully charged with reduced max thrust at lower battery percentages. i.e. if cruise speed is at 0.5 throttle at 100% battery, it will still be 0.5 at 60% battery.

parameters.shortDesc: Pitch trim increment for flaps configuration
parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_P_FLPS
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to the pitch trim whenever flaps are fully deployed.

parameters.shortDesc: Pitch trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMAX
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameters.shortDesc: Pitch trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMIN
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameters.shortDesc: Roll trim increment for flaps configuration
parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_R_FLPS
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL whenever flaps are fully deployed.

parameters.shortDesc: Roll trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMAX
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameters.shortDesc: Roll trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMIN
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameters.shortDesc: Yaw trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMAX
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameters.shortDesc: Yaw trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMIN
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameters.name: FW_FLAPS_LND_SCL
parameters.longDesc: Sets a fraction of full flaps (FW_FLAPS_SCL) during landing

parameters.name: FW_FLAPS_TO_SCL
parameters.longDesc: Sets a fraction of full flaps (FW_FLAPS_SCL) during take-off

parameters.name: FW_MAN_P_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Max pitch for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameters.name: FW_MAN_P_SC
parameters.longDesc: Scale factor applied to the desired pitch actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameters.name: FW_MAN_R_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Max roll for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameters.name: FW_MAN_R_SC
parameters.longDesc: Scale factor applied to the desired roll actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameters.name: FW_MAN_Y_SC
parameters.longDesc: Scale factor applied to the desired yaw actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameters.name: FW_PR_FF
parameters.longDesc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameters.name: FW_PR_I
parameters.longDesc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameters.name: FW_PR_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameters.name: FW_PR_P
parameters.longDesc: This defines how much the elevator input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameters.name: FW_PSP_OFF
parameters.longDesc: An airframe specific offset of the pitch setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the pitch setpoint and should correspond to the typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameters.name: FW_P_RMAX_NEG
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum pitch down up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_P_RMAX_POS
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum pitch up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_P_TC
parameters.longDesc: This defines the latency between a pitch step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameters.name: FW_RATT_TH
parameters.longDesc: Manual input needed in order to override attitude control rate setpoints and instead pass manual stick inputs as rate setpoints

parameters.shortDesc: Roll control to yaw control feedforward gain
parameters.name: FW_RLL_TO_YAW_FF
parameters.longDesc: This gain can be used to counteract the "adverse yaw" effect for fixed wings. When the plane enters a roll it will tend to yaw the nose out of the turn. This gain enables the use of a yaw actuator (rudder, airbrakes, ...) to counteract this effect.

parameters.name: FW_RR_FF
parameters.longDesc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output. Use this to obtain a tigher response of the controller without introducing noise amplification.

parameters.name: FW_RR_I
parameters.longDesc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameters.name: FW_RR_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value.

parameters.name: FW_RR_P
parameters.longDesc: This defines how much the aileron input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameters.name: FW_RSP_OFF
parameters.longDesc: An airframe specific offset of the roll setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the roll setpoint and should correspond to the typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameters.name: FW_R_RMAX
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum roll rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_R_TC
parameters.longDesc: This defines the latency between a roll step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameters.name: FW_WR_FF
parameters.longDesc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameters.name: FW_WR_I
parameters.longDesc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameters.name: FW_WR_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameters.name: FW_WR_P
parameters.longDesc: This defines how much the wheel steering input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameters.name: FW_W_RMAX
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum wheel steering rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_YR_FF
parameters.longDesc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameters.name: FW_YR_I
parameters.longDesc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameters.name: FW_YR_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameters.name: FW_YR_P
parameters.longDesc: This defines how much the rudder input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameters.name: FW_Y_RMAX
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum yaw rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF
parameters.longDesc: If the altitude error exceeds this parameter, the system will climb out with maximum throttle and minimum airspeed until it is closer than this distance to the desired altitude. Mostly used for takeoff waypoints / modes. Set to 0 to disable climbout mode (not recommended).

parameters.name: FW_L1_DAMPING
parameters.longDesc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameters.name: FW_L1_PERIOD
parameters.longDesc: This is the L1 distance and defines the tracking point ahead of the aircraft its following. A value of 18-25 meters works for most aircraft. Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameters.shortDesc: L1 controller roll slew rate limit
parameters.name: FW_L1_R_SLEW_MAX
parameters.longDesc: The maxium change in roll angle setpoint per second.

parameters.shortDesc: Min. airspeed scaling factor for landing
parameters.name: FW_LND_AIRSPD_SC
parameters.longDesc: Multiplying this factor with the minimum airspeed of the plane gives the target airspeed the landing approach. FW_AIRSPD_MIN * FW_LND_AIRSPD_SC

parameters.name: FW_LND_EARLYCFG
parameters.longDesc: When disabled, the landing configuration (flaps, landing airspeed, etc.) is only activated on the final approach to landing. When enabled, it is already activated when entering the final loiter-down (loiter-to-alt) waypoint before the landing approach. This shifts the (often large) altitude and airspeed errors caused by the configuration change away from the ground such that these are not so critical. It also gives the controller enough time to adapt to the new configuration such that the landing approach starts with a cleaner initial state.

parameters.shortDesc: Landing flare altitude (relative to landing altitude)
parameters.name: FW_LND_FLALT
FW_LND_FL_PMAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once FW_LND_FLALT is reached

parameters.name: FW_LND_FL_PMIN
parameters.longDesc: Minimum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once FW_LND_FLALT is reached

parameters.shortDesc:
Landing heading hold horizontal distance.
Set to 0 to disable heading hold
parameters.name: FW_LND_HHDIST

parameters.shortDesc: Throttle time constant factor for landing
parameters.name: FW_LND_THRTC_SC
parameters.longDesc: Set this parameter to less than 1.0 to make the TECS throttle loop react faster during landing than during normal flight (i.e. giving efficiency and low motor wear at high altitudes but control accuracy during landing). During landing, the TECS throttle time constant (FW_T_THRO_CONST) is multiplied by this value.

parameters.shortDesc: Landing throttle limit altitude (relative landing altitude)
parameters.name: FW_LND_TLALT
parameters.longDesc: Default of -1.0 lets the system default to applying throttle limiting at 2/3 of the flare altitude.

parameters.name: FW_LND_USETER
parameters.longDesc: This is turned off by default and a waypoint or return altitude is normally used (or sea level for an arbitrary land position).

parameters.name: FW_P_LIM_MAX
parameters.longDesc: The maximum positive pitch the controller will output.

parameters.name: FW_P_LIM_MIN
parameters.longDesc: The minimum negative pitch the controller will output.

parameters.name: FW_R_LIM
parameters.longDesc: The maximum roll the controller will output.

parameters.name: FW_THR_ALT_SCL
parameters.longDesc: Automatically adjust throttle to account for decreased air density at higher altitudes. Start with a scale factor of 1.0 and adjust for different propulsion systems. When flying without airspeed sensor this will help to keep a constant performance over large altitude ranges. The default value of 0 will disable scaling.

parameters.name: FW_THR_CRUISE
parameters.longDesc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve the desired cruise speed. Most airframes have a value of 0.5-0.7.

parameters.name: FW_THR_IDLE
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum throttle while on the ground For aircraft with internal combustion engine this parameter should be set above desired idle rpm.

parameters.shortDesc: Throttle limit during landing below throttle limit altitude
parameters.name: FW_THR_LND_MAX
parameters.longDesc: During the flare of the autonomous landing process, this value will be set as throttle limit when the aircraft altitude is below FW_LND_TLALT.

parameters.name: FW_THR_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For overpowered aircraft, this should be reduced to a value that provides sufficient thrust to climb at the maximum pitch angle PTCH_MAX.

parameters.name: FW_THR_MIN
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For electric aircraft this will normally be set to zero, but can be set to a small non-zero value if a folding prop is fitted to prevent the prop from folding and unfolding repeatedly in-flight or to provide some aerodynamic drag from a turning prop to improve the descent rate. For aircraft with internal combustion engine this parameter should be set for desired idle rpm.

parameters.name: FW_THR_SLEW_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum slew rate for the commanded throttle

parameters.name: LAUN_CAT_A
parameters.longDesc: LAUN_CAT_A for LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameters.name: LAUN_CAT_MDEL
parameters.longDesc: Delay between starting attitude control and powering up the throttle (giving throttle control to the controller) Before this timespan is up the throttle will be set to FW_THR_IDLE, set to 0 to deactivate

parameters.shortDesc: Maximum pitch before the throttle is powered up (during motor delay phase)
parameters.name: LAUN_CAT_PMAX
parameters.longDesc: This is an extra limit for the maximum pitch which is imposed in the phase before the throttle turns on. This allows to limit the maximum pitch angle during a bungee launch (make the launch less steep).

parameters.name: LAUN_CAT_T
parameters.longDesc: LAUN_CAT_A for LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameters.name: FW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameters.longDesc: If the airspeed is above this value, the TECS controller will try to decrease airspeed more aggressively.

parameters.name: FW_AIRSPD_MIN
parameters.longDesc: If the airspeed falls below this value, the TECS controller will try to increase airspeed more aggressively.

parameters.name: FW_AIRSPD_TRIM
parameters.longDesc: The fixed wing controller tries to fly at this airspeed.

parameters.name: FW_GND_SPD_MIN
parameters.longDesc: The controller will increase the commanded airspeed to maintain this minimum groundspeed to the next waypoint.

parameters.name: FW_T_CLMB_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the best climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the default value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced. The setting of this parameter can be checked by commanding a positive altitude change of 100m in loiter, RTL or guided mode. If the throttle required to climb is close to THR_MAX and the aircraft is maintaining airspeed, then this parameter is set correctly. If the airspeed starts to reduce, then the parameter is set to high, and if the throttle demand required to climb and maintain speed is noticeably less than FW_THR_MAX, then either FW_T_CLMB_MAX should be increased or FW_THR_MAX reduced.

parameters.name: FW_T_INTEG_GAIN
parameters.longDesc: This is the integrator gain on the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot. Set this value to zero to completely disable all integrator action.

parameters.name: FW_T_PTCH_DAMP
parameters.longDesc: This is the damping gain for the pitch demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in height. The default value of 0.0 will work well provided the pitch to servo controller has been tuned properly.

parameters.name: FW_T_RLL2THR
parameters.longDesc: Increasing this gain turn increases the amount of throttle that will be used to compensate for the additional drag created by turning. Ideally this should be set to  approximately 10 x the extra sink rate in m/s created by a 45 degree bank turn. Increase this gain if the aircraft initially loses energy in turns and reduce if the aircraft initially gains energy in turns. Efficient high aspect-ratio aircraft (eg powered sailplanes) can use a lower value, whereas inefficient low aspect-ratio models (eg delta wings) can use a higher value.

parameters.name: FW_T_SINK_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This sets the maximum descent rate that the controller will use. If this value is too large, the aircraft can over-speed on descent. This should be set to a value that can be achieved without exceeding the lower pitch angle limit and without over-speeding the aircraft.

parameters.name: FW_T_SINK_MIN
parameters.longDesc: This is the sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and flown at the same airspeed as used to measure FW_T_CLMB_MAX.

parameters.name: FW_T_SPDWEIGHT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter adjusts the amount of weighting that the pitch control applies to speed vs height errors. Setting it to 0.0 will cause the pitch control to control height and ignore speed errors. This will normally improve height accuracy but give larger airspeed errors. Setting it to 2.0 will cause the pitch control loop to control speed and ignore height errors. This will normally reduce airspeed errors, but give larger height errors. The default value of 1.0 allows the pitch control to simultaneously control height and speed. Note to Glider Pilots - set this parameter to 2.0 (The glider will adjust its pitch angle to maintain airspeed, ignoring changes in height).

parameters.name: FW_T_SPD_OMEGA
parameters.longDesc: This is the cross-over frequency (in radians/second) of the complementary filter used to fuse longitudinal acceleration and airspeed to obtain an improved airspeed estimate. Increasing this frequency weights the solution more towards use of the airspeed sensor, whilst reducing it weights the solution more towards use of the accelerometer data.

parameters.name: FW_T_THRO_CONST
parameters.longDesc: This is the time constant of the TECS throttle control algorithm (in seconds). Smaller values make it faster to respond, larger values make it slower to respond.

parameters.name: FW_T_THR_DAMP
parameters.longDesc: This is the damping gain for the throttle demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in speed and height.

parameters.name: FW_T_TIME_CONST
parameters.longDesc: This is the time constant of the TECS control algorithm (in seconds). Smaller values make it faster to respond, larger values make it slower to respond.

parameters.name: FW_T_VERT_ACC
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum vertical acceleration (in m/s/s) either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors. The default value of 7 m/s/s (equivalent to +- 0.7 g) allows for reasonably aggressive pitch changes if required to recover from under-speed conditions.

parameters.shortDesc:
Enable checks on ESCs that report their arming state.
If enabled, failure detector will verify that all the ESCs have successfully armed when the vehicle has transitioned to the armed state.
Timeout for receiving an acknowledgement from the ESCs is 0.3s, if no feedback is received the failure detector will auto disarm the vehicle
parameters.name: FD_ESCS_EN

parameters.shortDesc:
Enable PWM input on AUX5 or MAIN5 (depending on board) for engaging failsafe from an external
automatic trigger system (ATS)
parameters.name: FD_EXT_ATS_EN
parameters.longDesc: External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameters.shortDesc: The PWM threshold from external automatic trigger system for engaging failsafe
parameters.name: FD_EXT_ATS_TRIG
parameters.longDesc: External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_P
parameters.longDesc: Maximum pitch angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_P_TTRI
parameters.longDesc: Seconds (decimal) that pitch has to exceed FD_FAIL_P before being considered as a failure.

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_R
parameters.longDesc: Maximum roll angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_R_TTRI
parameters.longDesc: Seconds (decimal) that roll has to exceed FD_FAIL_R before being considered as a failure.

parameters.name: NAV_FT_DST
parameters.longDesc: The distance in meters to follow the target at

parameters.name: NAV_FT_FS
parameters.longDesc: The side to follow the target from (front right = 0, behind = 1, front = 2, front left = 3)

parameters.shortDesc:
Dynamic filtering algorithm responsiveness to target movement
lower numbers increase the responsiveness to changing long lat
but also ignore less noise
parameters.name: NAV_FT_RS
NAV_MIN_FT_HT
parameters.longDesc: The minimum height in meters relative to home for following a target

parameters.name: GPS_1_CONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run Main GPS.

parameters.name: GPS_2_CONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run Secondary GPS.

parameters.shortDesc: Dump GPS communication to a file
parameters.name: GPS_DUMP_COMM
parameters.longDesc: If this is set to 1, all GPS communication data will be published via uORB, and written to the log file as gps_dump message.

parameters.name: GPS_UBX_DYNMODEL
parameters.longDesc: u-blox receivers support different dynamic platform models to adjust the navigation engine to the expected application environment.

parameters.shortDesc: Heading/Yaw offset for dual antenna GPS
parameters.name: GPS_YAW_OFFSET
parameters.longDesc: Heading offset angle for dual antenna GPS setups that support heading estimation. (currently only for the Trimble MB-Two). Set this to 0 if the antennas are parallel to the forward-facing direction of the vehicle and the first antenna is in front. The offset angle increases counterclockwise. Set this to 90 if the first antenna is placed on the right side and the second on the left side of the vehicle.

parameters.name: NAV_GPSF_LT
parameters.longDesc: The time in seconds the system should do open loop loiter and wait for GPS recovery before it goes into flight termination. Set to 0 to disable.

parameters.name: NAV_GPSF_P
parameters.longDesc: Pitch in degrees during the open loop loiter

parameters.name: NAV_GPSF_R
parameters.longDesc: Roll in degrees during the loiter

parameters.name: NAV_GPSF_TR
parameters.longDesc: Thrust value which is set during the open loop loiter

parameters.name: GF_ACTION
parameters.longDesc: Note: Setting this value to 4 enables flight termination, which will kill the vehicle on violation of the fence. Due to the inherent danger of this, this function is disabled using a software circuit breaker, which needs to be reset to 0 to really shut down the system.

parameters.name: GF_ALTMODE
parameters.longDesc: Select which altitude reference should be used 0 = WGS84, 1 = AMSL

parameters.name: GF_COUNT
parameters.longDesc: Set how many subsequent position measurements outside of the fence are needed before geofence violation is triggered

parameters.name: GF_MAX_HOR_DIST
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameters.name: GF_MAX_VER_DIST
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameters.name: GF_SOURCE
parameters.longDesc: Select which position source should be used. Selecting GPS instead of global position makes sure that there is no dependence on the position estimator 0 = global position, 1 = GPS

parameters.name: HTE_ACC_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: HTE_HT_ERR_INIT
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: HTE_HT_NOISE
parameters.longDesc: Reduce to make the hover thrust estimate more stable, increase if the real hover thrust is expected to change quickly over time.

parameters.name: ISBD_CONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run Iridium (with MAVLink).

parameters.shortDesc: Satellite radio read interval. Only required to be nonzero if data is not sent using a ring call
parameters.name: ISBD_READ_INT

parameters.shortDesc:
Time [ms] the Iridium driver will wait for additional mavlink messages to combine them into one SBD message
Value 0 turns the functionality off
parameters.name: ISBD_STACK_TIME
LNDFW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum airspeed allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameters.name: LNDFW_VEL_XY_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameters.name: LNDFW_VEL_Z_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s up and down)

parameters.name: LNDFW_XYACC_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal (x,y body axes) acceleration allowed in the landed state (m/s^2)

parameters.name: LNDMC_ALT_MAX
parameters.longDesc: The system will obey this limit as a hard altitude limit. This setting will be consolidated with the GF_MAX_VER_DIST parameter. A negative value indicates no altitude limitation.

parameters.name: LNDMC_ROT_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum allowed angular velocity around each axis allowed in the landed state.

parameters.name: LNDMC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameters.name: LNDMC_Z_VEL_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s up and down)

parameters.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_HI
parameters.longDesc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Higher 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameters.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_LO
parameters.longDesc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Lower 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameters.name: LTEST_ACC_UNC
parameters.longDesc: Variance of acceleration measurement used for landing target position prediction. Higher values results in tighter following of the measurements and more lenient outlier rejection

parameters.name: LTEST_MEAS_UNC
parameters.longDesc: Variance of the landing target measurement from the driver. Higher values results in less agressive following of the measurement and a smoother output as well as fewer rejected measurements.

parameters.name: LTEST_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Configure the mode of the landing target. Depending on the mode, the landing target observations are used differently to aid position estimation. Mode Moving:     The landing target may be moving around while in the field of view of the vehicle. Landing target measurements are not used to aid positioning. Mode Stationary: The landing target is stationary. Measured velocity w.r.t. the landing target is used to aid velocity estimation.

parameters.name: LTEST_POS_UNC_IN
parameters.longDesc: Initial variance of the relative landing target position in x and y direction

parameters.shortDesc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor x axis
parameters.name: LTEST_SCALE_X
parameters.longDesc: Landing target x measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameters.shortDesc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor y axis
parameters.name: LTEST_SCALE_Y
parameters.longDesc: Landing target y measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameters.name: LTEST_VEL_UNC_IN
parameters.longDesc: Initial variance of the relative landing target velocity in x and y direction

parameters.name: LPE_ACC_XY
parameters.longDesc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz) Larger than data sheet to account for tilt error.

parameters.name: LPE_ACC_Z
parameters.longDesc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz)

parameters.shortDesc: Barometric presssure altitude z standard deviation
parameters.name: LPE_BAR_Z

parameters.shortDesc: Max EPH allowed for GPS initialization
parameters.name: LPE_EPH_MAX

parameters.shortDesc: Max EPV allowed for GPS initialization
parameters.name: LPE_EPV_MAX

parameters.shortDesc:
Enable publishing of a fake global position (e.g for AUTO missions using Optical Flow)
by initializing the estimator to the LPE_LAT/LON parameters when global information is unavailable
parameters.name: LPE_FAKE_ORIGIN

parameters.shortDesc: Flow gyro high pass filter cut off frequency
parameters.name: LPE_FGYRO_HP

parameters.shortDesc: Optical flow z offset from center
parameters.name: LPE_FLW_OFF_Z

parameters.shortDesc: Optical flow angular velocity noise gain
parameters.name: LPE_FLW_RR

bitmask.description: fuse GPS, requires GPS for alt. init

parameters.name: LPE_FUSION
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to fuse GPS data if available, also requires GPS for altitude init 1 : Set to true to fuse optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to fuse vision position 3 : Set to true to enable landing target 4 : Set to true to fuse land detector 5 : Set to true to publish AGL as local position down component 6 : Set to true to enable flow gyro compensation 7 : Set to true to enable baro fusion default (145 - GPS, baro, land detector)

parameters.shortDesc:
GPS xy velocity standard deviation.
EPV used if greater than this value
parameters.name: LPE_GPS_VXY

parameters.shortDesc: Minimum GPS xy standard deviation, uses reported EPH if greater

parameters.shortDesc: Minimum GPS z standard deviation, uses reported EPV if greater
parameters.name: LPE_GPS_Z

parameters.shortDesc: Land detector xy velocity standard deviation

parameters.shortDesc: Local origin latitude for nav w/o GPS
parameters.name: LPE_LAT

parameters.shortDesc: Lidar z offset from center of vehicle +down
parameters.name: LPE_LDR_OFF_Z

parameters.shortDesc: Local origin longitude for nav w/o GPS

parameters.shortDesc: Minimum landing target standard covariance, uses reported covariance if greater
parameters.name: LPE_LT_COV
LPE_PN_P
parameters.longDesc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameters.shortDesc: Terrain random walk noise density, hilly/outdoor (0.1), flat/Indoor (0.001)

LPE_PN_V
parameters.longDesc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameters.shortDesc: Sonar z offset from center of vehicle +down
parameters.name: LPE_SNR_OFF_Z

parameters.shortDesc:
Terrain maximum percent grade, hilly/outdoor (100 = 45 deg), flat/Indoor (0 = 0 deg)
Used to calculate increased terrain random walk nosie due to movement
parameters.name: LPE_T_MAX_GRADE
LPE_VIS_DELAY
parameters.longDesc: Set to zero to enable automatic compensation from measurement timestamps
